But the options I, II, III must refer to specific disadvantages. Since the user hasn't provided the actual options, maybe this is a standard question where the options are commonly known.

Wait, perhaps this is a standard question from a textbook or a test. Let me recall. Longitudinal studies have several disadvantages. Common ones include: 1) time-consuming and expensive, 2) participant attrition (people dropping out over time), 3) possible practice effects (participants getting better at the tasks over time due to experience), 4) cohort effects (the group being studied might change over time, not just individual development), and 5) the difficulty in maintaining consistent procedures over long periods.

Assuming that the options I, II, III refer to these common disadvantages. For example, if I is "time-consuming and expensive," II is "participant attrition," and III is "practice effects," then the question is asking which of these is a disadvantage.
